title: M004: Migrate all controller tests and test infrastructure to v1beta1
description:

**Priority:** high

New package ap'

Update the entire test suite to use v1beta1 types:

1. **internal/controller/suite_test.go** ‚Äî Register v1beta1 scheme alongside v1alpha1 (both needed for conversion tests). Set up v1beta1 webhooks in the envtest environment. Ensure the test environment supports multi-version CRD with conversion.
2. **~30 test files in internal/controller/** ‚Äî Mechanical migration: replace all `v1alpha1.Memcached` with `v1beta1.Memcached`, update import aliases, update object creation helpers, update type assertions. Since schema is identical, test logic remains unchanged.
3. Verify all tests pass with `make test` after migration.

This is primarily a mechanical find-and-replace operation across test files, but must be done carefully to ensure no references are missed.

**Rationale:** Tests must match the types the controller actually uses. Running tests against v1alpha1 types while the controller uses v1beta1 would cause compilation failures and wouldn't test the actual production code path.

**Affected Areas:**
- internal/controller/suite_test.go
- internal/controller/*_test.go

**Size:** üèóÔ∏è large **Category:** backend **Priority:** high ## Summary Promote the Memcached CRD API from `v1alpha1` to `v1beta1`. The new `v1beta1` becomes the **storage version** (hub) while `v1alpha1` is retained as a **served but non-storage spoke** for backward compatibility. A conversion webhook enables automatic translation between versions. The controller, defaulting webhooks, and validation webhooks all move to `v1beta1` types; the v1alpha1 webhooks are removed entirely ‚Äî the API server converts v1alpha1 requests to the storage version before admission runs. ## Scope **Included:** - New `api/v1beta1/` package with Memcached types (identical schema to v1alpha1, promoted) - `api/v1beta1/groupversion_info.go` ‚Äî `memcached.c5c3.io/v1beta1` registration - `api/v1beta1/memcached_conversion.go` ‚Äî `conversion.Hub` implementation (empty `Hub()` method) - `api/v1alpha1/memcached_conversion.go` ‚Äî `conversion.Convertible` implementation (`ConvertTo`/`ConvertFrom`) - Defaulting webhook (`MemcachedCustomDefaulter`) for v1beta1 ‚Äî migrated from v1alpha1 - Validation webhook (`MemcachedCustomValidator`) for v1beta1 ‚Äî migrated from v1alpha1 - **Remove** `api/v1alpha1/memcached_webhook.go` and `api/v1alpha1/memcached_validation_webhook.go` (rely on conversion + v1beta1 webhooks) - CRD manifest: `v1beta1` with `storage: true`, `v1alpha1` with `storage: false, served: true`, conversion webhook strategy - Conversion webhook configuration in `config/webhook/` - Controller switched from `memcachedv1alpha1.Memcached` to `memcachedv1beta1.Memcached` - `cmd/main.go` ‚Äî register v1beta1 scheme, setup v1beta1 webhooks - `suite_test.go` ‚Äî register v1beta1 scheme + webhooks - Builder functions (`constructDeployment`, `constructService`, `constructPDB`, `constructNetworkPolicy`, `constructServiceMonitor`) accept v1beta1 types - All ~30 controller test files migrated to v1beta1 types - v1beta1 sample YAML files in `config/samples/` - Migration documentation with deprecation notice for v1alpha1 **Excluded (YAGNI):** - New fields or schema changes in v1beta1 (autoscaling, etc.) ‚Äî separate feature - Automated data migration tooling ‚Äî API server handles conversion transparently - v1alpha1 removal ‚Äî premature, users need deprecation window - Helm chart or OLM bundle updates ‚Äî separate concern -
